name: Recollection (xgdesign)
description:
Description  Inspirations

We were drawn to making this game as heartbreak is a universal experience that although personal in many ways, can be relatable in many others.

Our inspirations were drawn by atmospheric story exploration games such as Marie’s room and Life is strange.

We wanted the game to simulate a first-person experience grappling memories of romantic separation in visual novelesque style, with interactive visual gameplay with objects featuring narrative literature.

As the main focus of the game is unfolding the tale through exploring items, the objects are in a lighted space and easily identifiable. It should be an enjoyable experience not a frustrating one. Each scene reflects a stage of loss. Denial and isolation, sadness, frustration and bargaining and finally acceptance.

This game walks us through those transitions to a closing phase marked by withdrawal and calm.

Future plans: 

If we were to continue to work on this project post- assignment, we would like to introduce…

  •  More intricate narrative
  • More rooms and objects to explore
  • More cohesive objects
  • The perspective of her past lover 
  • Puzzles to complete (combining the hidden object game play with simple puzzles to unlock story text)
  • Explore the option of adding voice overs for the characters
Game controls: 

Within each scene, there are objects to be interacted with - use your mouse to click these items and reveal their backstory...
